review: I have two of these now. That's how much I like them. I recently canceled my TV service (via satellite) because it was getting just too darned expensive. With the Roku stick I have access to every show I would have watched via satellite. Some are free, and some are via a service that requires a monthly or annual payment. It's still much cheaper than what I paid for my satellite service. I also have a Chromecast device, which is good, but not as good as the Roku, imho. With the Roku you don't need a phone or tablet to control the device.
author: Sue Eckhardt

review: I love this stick. It has a few quirks however  I would recommend it to my friends. I bought the stick because I did not want to have another box sitting on my tv stand. Also this stick had access to all the apps that I wanted Amazon vudu Hulu Netflix crackle crunchy roll etc...After using it for about a month the only down side that I have found is that sometimes if it's been on too long 6hrs or so I have to turn it off and back on.My favorite feature is by far that search function for tv shows and movies across all the apps.
author: Stephanie "Sappho"
